reviews.review_msg: Antone Minard is one of the best professors I have ever had! He is very caring and cares for his students. He is deeply passionate about Greek Mythology, and his passion is indeed contagious. I seriously believe he is a professional story teller the way he narrates the iconic myths with such lively expression. I wish I could take this class again!

Dr. Minard is funny and passionate about mythology, and his lectures were engaging. However, he doesn't post his slides, so you have to take notes yourselves. The midterm was fairly easy, and there were only a few papers in addition to the final paper. His criteria is clear, but also not too specific, allowing for creative freedom.

Dr. Minard was an excellent prof! He is clearly passionate about the subject matter and was happy to discuss outside experience with the subject matter. His lectures can be a little scattered, they get all the necessary info across just fine. His marking feedback is thorough and detailed, and I found his grading to be forgiving. Highly recommended!

Absolutely loved and enjoyed taking my first humanities course with Dr. Minard. While this is the only humanities course I'll ever take due to it not being my major, I still use what Antone has referenced to my current classes and conversations. His enthusiasm and witty comments in class had me engaged throughout the semester.

This was a really great class! I looked forward to attending this course every week, and it seemed that most of my classmates felt this way as well. He is really passionate about understanding different religions, and has tons of funny stories to tell. There are bi-weekly quizzes on religions, and a couple of papers. Would take again :)

Prof Minard is undoubtedly passionate about what he teaches, however, I found that he graded assignments on the harsher side. This may be partially due to the fact that he doesn't really give out a proper rubric or detailed enough assignment instructions for the various papers/projects that had to be done. Also, participation matters in the class!

He is a great professor, hilarious and makes his students feel comfortable in class. The only reason I am not retaking his classes is that the requirements for his assignments are not clear and too broad for me. However, some students feel that his assignments were acceptable. He is a bit of a tough grader on his essays.

This was my third class with Antone and I was once again NOT disappointed. His lectures and discussions are very informative and engaging. You can tell he really enjoys what he is teaching. He gives great feedback and is a very fair marker. Super caring prof, definitely recommend!

For context, this was a tiny STT-seminar course on the Grimm Brothers. Antone is so nice and passionate about the topic. His syllabus makes him seem incredibly tough, and he can be nit-picky about certain things, but overall he is very kind and accommodating to his students. Participate tons!!!! Be engaged and do your readings.

This class is enjoyable if you ACTUALLY READ THE LITERATURE ASSIGNED, if you don't it's boring and stressful. If you know the books you have to read for the class BEFORE classes start, READ THEM. It saves so much time (Library, Online etc...). There are 2 essays about 1400 words and the final was 3 essay questions in 2 hours. Minard's a good prof.

Professor is good, hes funny and a good guy. The class Contents however were BRUTAL. One of the most boring classes yet, 9 books assigned to read and they are so dry and boring. Lectures were useless he just went over useless stuff from the book. No midterm which is nice but 2 papers that are fairly easy as long as u read 4/9 books.

Antone is a really nice person and his lectures are quite entertaining, however I feel the workload was unnecessarily high and the final exam was a joke. He made us write 3 essays in 2 hours and the questions were super obscure and confusing. I wouldn't recommend taking English 201 in general, but definitely not with this prof.

Minard isn't the worst prof I've had, but hes definitely not the best. Would go off on occasional tangents in lectures that you didn't need to know, but you have to attend lecture because of the exam hints he occasionally gives. Wasn't clear on any assignments & no proper rubric for the final paper. plus an agonizing group project.

Rarely do you find as good of a communicator of information as Antone Minard. Not only is he evidently pasionate about what he teaches, but does his best to involve the class' thoughts and push students to consider interesting themes. He expects a lot of you in the best possible way; definitely one of the best profs I've ever had.

Dr. Minard was absolutely awesome, you can tell that he really cares a lot about the subject matter he teaches. He has a crazy wide range of knowledge that he is happy to share with any of his students. He provides excellent feedback. Overall I would highly recommend taking one of his courses, he is a great lecturer and his assignments are fair.

Antone was a great prof who really knows his materials, he was also my "TA" for my tutorial section. My only complaint is that the other TAs would talk about how to write good essays and what not whilst our class would essentially continue on from the lecture. If you go to class and take notes you will have no problems when it comes to the final!
He is soooooo funny. Also a great prof. He is intelligent and shares his knowledge. Great pedagogical skills.

engl201 was the worst class ive taken but it wasnt antones fault. He has some weird rules but hes a good prof. hes funny and pretty straightforward. There was a final essay AND a final exam, 1 group project, 2 assignments, and a 2500word paper, so, not the easiest, but Antone is far from being a bad prof, he sure isn't an easy-A tho. I got a c LOL
Prof was very passionate and interesting to listen to. Material we read was boring at times

Antone is such an amazing professor, who is insanely passionate about the subject! He always made lectures fun, even with dry subject matters. Text was unnecessary because he always highlighted important passages in class - so dont skip class as he likes to make important notes in spite of the people who dont show up. Would take his course again!

Dr Minard is just a real stand up guy. Super class act. The absolute sickest. Dr Minard is the coolest English prof out there let me tell ya. Heart of gold and super passionate. He's funny and makes the lectures personal. He doesn't do slides with notes on them and uses purely examples to explain his point but still makes it easy to follow.

Do NOT take his class if you need a GPA Booster. Attendance isn't mandatory but has participation marks. A lot of reading, w/ quizzes every other week on lecture and readings, and 2 essays - harsh marker on essays, very opinionated & will pick on every sentence of your writing. Material is dry & all over the place so try your best to stay away!

Antone is a really good prof to have for 100 level English classes because he really knows how to ease people into reading a ton of material regularly. He starts off with easy small texts and works his ways up. He is also really good at leading discussion and makes it easy to pick out what you want to write about for your papers.

Lectures were boring, and often did not go with course material. Several books that needed to be read for this course, but can still get a decent mark by watching the movies and reading the summaries (I only read 2/7 books). Don't need to attend lecture as long as you understand the material being read, but must go to tutorial
Antone is really nice and approachable and definitely helps you out. However, he is a tough marker so make sure you ask for feedback because it'll help you understand what he is looking for.

I loved attending class because he made lectures engaging. He is a hard marker though, and somewhat pretentious (there was almost a whole page on how to address emails to him in the syllabus). I would definitely take a class with him again.
Dr. Minard is humorous. He didn't assign topics for final essay which gives us freedom.

Dr. Minard was really great. I ended up taking this course out, because I got late admittance. It was a great choice. The textbook isn't essential since you can find the work online. Dr. Minard was always available for help, easily accessible over email and gave extensions even at the last minute. The resources for all assignments are all there

While his humour is nice  in lectures, his teaching style is all over the place. It really does not feel like an academic setting, but more like a high school, surface-level analyzing of the readings.. which is why it is confusing when his marking is so harsh given that the class discussions are often humorous and not exactly in depth. Yikes
He's very nice and friendly :)
He's amazing. That's all!

Minard should write a book, not be a teacher. He is really opinionated and only teaches what he likes. Gives no criteria for assignments and gives little or broad feedback. Only replies with "weak thesis" but does not help or any explanation. Gives us an hour break for a four hour class. Expects you to know all history before class. CONDESCENDING
Truly wonderful professor. Engaging, fun, and encouraging. Impressive depth and breadth of knowledge. Just put in some effort (do the readings - they're good for you!) and he'll recognize it.

I found him really funny and he makes the material MUCH easier to understand than when you read it on your own. He's very insightful and intelligent, and he keeps lectures interesting which is nice. Very high expectations for essays.  You have to really work hard to get a good grade. Great prof.

He's interesting, comedic, helpful, and clear; I think he is a great prof. However, there are readings and quizzes every week and the essays are tough. His expectations are too high for a first year course but I like his class regardless.

He is really interested in what he teaches and tries to engage everyone in class. For a 3 hour lecture it seemed to drag on sometimes, but his exams are fair and relatively easy if you read the books and reviewed your notes. He is helpful in office hours as well. The only problem was that the grading scale seemed a bit off from the normal scale.

The marking guide is disproportionate to the fact that it was a first year writing course. Heavy amounts of reading and weekly quizzes that hit on obscure information. He's nice, yes, and he's very passionate about the field. But be prepared to fight for a good grade, though.
